questions.title: Good morning, friends!
questions.description: It's time for our morning check-in! Let's see how we're doing today.

questions.title: Why do we do a check-in each morning?
questions.description: It is important to pause to see how we are doing in our minds and hearts. It helps us be our best for ourselves and others.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash

questions.question: How are you feeling today?

imageMetadata.resources: Image by Annalise Batista from Pixabay

questions.resources: Image by Annalise Batista from Pixabay

questions.title: Remember...
questions.description: Noticing our emotions can help us talk about feelings more clearly, solve problems more easily, and move past difficult feelings.

imageMetadata.resources: Image by Pete Linforth from Pixabay

questions.resources: Image by Pete Linforth from Pixabay

questions.title: What are you grateful for today?
questions.description: In your head, think of 1, 2 or 3 things you are grateful for.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Gabrielle Henderson on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Gabrielle Henderson on Unsplash

questions.question: Why do we notice what we are grateful for?

choices.answer: It helps us feel less stressed
It helps us appreciate what we have right now
It helps us act more kindly to others

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Jacqueline Munguía on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Jacqueline Munguía on Unsplash

questions.question: Are you excited about something today?

questions.title: Think of a goal you want to work towards today.
questions.description: It's important to set goals to help us focus, make good choices and boost our confidence!

questions.question: I know what my goal is for today.

choices.answer: I need some help setting my goal

questions.question: Would you like a personal check-in with someone today?

choices.answer: Yes, but it's not a rush
